div1.p: TX
WS Circuit Court, Ninth Circuit CountyState of Washington

Ex Parte ML Coovert Plaintiff vs.
Defendant
Bond on Appeal Clerk will appear within bond
Filed July 3, 1893
A. Reeves Ayres Clerk R. M. Hopkins Deputy
W. C. Jones, Attorny General
State of Washington
in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington ninth circuit Northern Division.
In the matter of the proceeding of M. L. Coovert for a writ of habeas corpus.
Bond on Appeal.

Know all Men by these Presents: that we Geo S Shannon and L R Homes are held and firmly bound unto M. L. Coovert in the full and just sum of five hundred (500) Dollars to be paid to the said M. L. Coovert, his executors, administrators or assigns, to which payment well and truly to be made we bind ourselves and each of our heirs, executros and administrators jointly, severlly and firmly by these presents.
Sealed with out seals and dated this 24th day of June, 1893.

The condition of the foregoing obligation is such that whereas the said M. L. Coovert was heretofore by virtue of the laws of the State of Washington arrested and charged with the violation of a law of said State prohibiting the sale of cigarettes therein on eight seperate and distinct charges. And whereas lately at a term of the above entitled court duly held in the city of Seattle, this said M. L. Coovert was in each of said proceedings discharged from the custody of the authorities of the state of Washington upon writs of habeas corpus duly learned by the Judge of the above entitled court in each of the said proceedings. And whereas the State of Washington considering itself aggrieved by the sction aforesaid in discharging said M. L. Coovert from the custody of the authorities of the State of Washington has appealed from the judgement and sction of the said court in each of said
proceedings to the Supreme Court of the United States, and its appeal has been duly allowed by the Judge of said Court. And whereas in open court upon the 23d day of June, 1893 it was duly ordered and directed that the said State of Washington should execute a bond in the sum of five hundred (500) dollars to the said M. L. Coovert to secure the costs of said appeal to the said M. L. Coovert:

Now therefore, if the said State of Washington on shall duly prosecute the appeal in each of said cases and shall abide the order of the Supreme Court of the United Statesto effect and if it fail to make its plea good in any of said cases shall answer all costs therein, the this obligation to be void, otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
Geo (S) Shannon L. R. Homes

Geo D. Shanon and LR Homes being first duly sworn each for himself deposes and says that he is one of the sureties named in and who executed the foregoing bond, that he is a resident of the State of Washington and worth double the amount specified in the foregoing bond over and above his just debts and liabilites and exclusive of property exempt from execution.
Geo D. Shannon L. R. Homes
Subscribed and Sworn before me W. C. Jones, AD 1893 Brad W. Danig
